abuse.title: What counts as abuse ?
content: Abuse does not only mean physical violence. Many people face abuse without being hit.
Blocking you from leaving a room.
Making you feel worthless or scared.
Threatening to hurt you or themselves.
Controlling who you talk to or where you go.
Forcing you to stay at home.
Any forced or unwanted sexual action.
Being pressured into things you are not comfortable with.
If someone's behavior makes you feel afraid, trapped, or unsafe, it may be abuse.
Remember: Abuse is never your fault.

legal.title: Your legal rights
content: Everyone has the right to live safely and with dignity.
In India, the law recognizes that abuse can happen inside homes and relationships, and it provides protection to people facing such situations.
You have legal protection against abuse, even if the person harming you is:
Seek medical care if you are hurt.
Talk to trusted authorities or support services.
Get legal support if you choose.
permission from anyone to seek help.
Remember, even if the abuse has been happening for a long time, it is never too late to ask for support.
Remember, your safety and well-being matter the most.

helplines.title: Emergency helplines
content: If you feel unsafe or in immediate danger, help is available.
Even if you are unsure what to say.
If speaking is difficult, try to get to a safe place and reach out when you can.
